title: 103_hr2928
content: AGREEMENTS TO CORRECT POLLUTION. The Secretary of State can make agreements with Mexico to address pollution along the US-Mexico border caused by sewage discharge. Agreements should include recommendations for constructing facilities to protect people's health. The agreement between the United States and Mexico should include estimates of costs, formulas for cost division, review methods every five years, and construction dates for facilities to address pollution along the US-Mexico border. The Secretary of State, through the Commissioner, is authorized to plan, construct, operate, and maintain facilities in collaboration with Mexico. Consultation with the EPA Administrator and other authorities is required. Authorization of appropriations is also included. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Such sums may be appropriated for the United States to fund its share of the cost of facilities recommended in agreements approved by the Governments of the United States and Mexico. SEC. 5. ANNUAL REPORT. The Secretary of State, through the Commissioner, must prepare an annual report on the International Boundary and Water Commission's activities, including addressing pollution along the US-Mexico border caused by sewage discharge. The report should be submitted to the President and Congressional leaders within ninety days after each fiscal year. The Commissioner must provide an annual report on the progress made in concluding agreements, recommendations, facility operations, consultations with relevant officials, and any determined recommendations. The Commissioner must provide an annual report on progress in addressing pollution along the United States-Mexico border, including recommendations for correcting sewage and waste discharge issues. Additional information may be included as deemed necessary.
